snippet: Serena Williams coasted to the quarterfinals with a quick win over her sister, staying in contention for a calendar-year Grand Slam and showing that the gap between her and Venus was still widening.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column holds that Serena Williams' victory over her sister Venus Williams in fourth-round of Wimbledon Tennis Tournament shows gap is widening as they age; notes that Venus was first to turn professional and also first to win Wimbledon and reach No 1, but Serena has passed her by in terms of career achievements--racking up 20 Grand Slam singles titles and piling up weeks at No 1.
lead_paragraph: Serena Williams coasted to the quarterfinals with a quick win over her sister, staying in contention for a calendar-year Grand Slam and showing that the gap between her and Venus was still widening.

headline.print_headline: Siblings Forever, Rivals for Not Much Longer
headline.main: Serena and Venus Williams Are Siblings Forever, but Rivals for Not Much Longer
